Some measures of performance (issue 41)

Mauro Lepore

2017-08-29

Measuring performance

library(forestr)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

x <- bci12s7mini

system.time({
  with_dplyr <- count_status(x = x, .status = "A", sp)
  with_dplyr <- arrange(with_dplyr, sp)
})
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.12    0.00    0.13

system.time({
  # There may be a faster and more elegant way to do this in base
  .split <- split(x, x$sp)
  applied_1 <- lapply(.split, ctfs::abundance)
  applied_2 <- lapply(applied_1, "[[", "abund")
  
  sp <- names(applied_2)
  n <- lapply(applied_2, "[[", "all")
  n <- unlist(n)
  with_base <- data.frame(sp, n, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
  with_base <- with_base[order(with_base$sp), ]
})
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.45    0.00    0.47

head(with_dplyr)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>       sp     n
#>    <chr> <dbl>
#> 1 acaldi     5
#> 2 aegipa     0
#> 3 alchco     0
#> 4 alibed     2
#> 5 allops     0
#> 6 alsebl    21

head(with_base)
#>            sp  n
#> acaldi acaldi  5
#> aegipa aegipa  0
#> alchco alchco  0
#> alibed alibed  2
#> allops allops  0
#> alsebl alsebl 21

all.equal(with_dplyr, with_base)
#> [1] TRUE
stem <- bci::bci12full1
system.time(abundance_n(stem, group_by = c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.11    0.01    0.12
system.time(abundance_n2(stem, group_by = c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.06    0.00    0.07
system.time(n_dplyr(stem, sp, status, only_alive = FALSE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.06    0.00    0.06
system.time(n_dplyr_se(stem, groups = c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    0.06    0.00    0.06
system.time(n_plyr(stem, groups = c("sp", "status"), only_alive = FALSE))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>    5.64    0.31    6.13
